main event: A witness saw a bright flash of light above the southern horizon, estimating the object's size to be 2-3 times larger than the planet Venus, lasting less than 30 seconds.
interesting points: The observation was of a bright flash of light lasting only a quarter or half a second
The estimated size of the object was 2-3 times larger than Venus
The object was visible for less than 30 seconds
The report suggests it was probably a meteor
The address label indicates the report was part of Project Blue Book at Wright Patterson A.F.B.
sighted object: bright flash of light above the southern horizon
